title: Define Nuxt 4 + OpenFeature policies and foundational specs
description: Establish missing PRD/architecture/spec structure and add Nuxt4-module/OpenFeature-specific development policies; include review of current policy coverage.
design:
Business intent (PRD target)
- Establish clear product intent and acceptance criteria for this Nuxt 4 OpenFeature module so future implementation work does not proceed without business alignment.
- Remove ambiguity around supported providers, runtime boundaries, and client/server responsibilities.

Architectural considerations
- Module remains a Nuxt 4 local/packaged module with `configKey: openFeature` and explicit runtimeConfig split: server config under `runtimeConfig.openFeature`, client-safe values under `runtimeConfig.public.openFeature`.
- Feature flag evaluation must execute on server APIs; client receives evaluated values only.
- Context propagation from client to server uses bounded/signed header encoding; server validates size/encoding/hash before use.
- Public consumption uses module exports/auto-imports only; no app imports from module internals.

Proposed behavior
- Add missing specs hierarchy and indexes (`specs/prd`, `specs/architecture`, `specs/features`).
- Add PRD describing outcomes, user personas, and acceptance intent.
- Add architecture spec defining data flow, provider model, security boundaries, and non-goals.
- Add feature spec translating PRD+architecture into concrete module behavior.
- Add Nuxt4/OpenFeature-specific policy documents under development policies for repeatable implementation/review practice.

Acceptance signals
- Repository policy pointers resolve to existing files for PRD/architecture indexes.
- Policy docs explicitly cover Nuxt module conventions, runtime config boundaries, provider setup, tests, and release checks.
- Specs cross-reference each other and align to AGENTS source-of-truth ladder.
- Documentation review section calls out existing policy gaps and how new docs resolve them.
acceptance_criteria: Policy gaps are documented and resolved with explicit policy files; specs/prd, specs/architecture, specs/features contain baseline indexed documents for this module; documents cross-reference each other and align with AGENTS source-of-truth ladder.
notes:
Completed policy/spec baseline for Nuxt4 module + OpenFeature. Added missing PRD and architecture indexes, authored module PRD/architecture/feature specs, and documented policy review findings + remediation. Added new policies for Nuxt module development and OpenFeature governance; updated development policy index references. Quality gates run: pnpm lint (pass), pnpm test (pass).
